cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 15 miles south of Cayo Largo, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: moving WNW, forecast to turn NW then NNW and track across the central Gulf toward the northwest Gulf Coast, focusing on the Texas–Louisiana border area
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-west Gulf Coast near the Texas–Louisiana border (around Cameron Parish / Lake Charles area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued yet (hurricane and surge watches expected later for northwest Gulf Coast)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: north-west Gulf Coast from upper Texas coast through southwest Louisiana
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood (71%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds with up to a 41% chance of 50-kt winds; hurricane-force gusts (18-19% chance) possible if Laura intensifies before landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Life-threatening surge over 3 ft is likely along the southwest Louisiana coast, including Calcasieu and Sabine Lakes, as Laura comes ashore.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with localized totals up to 12 inches possible, producing flash and urban flooding in the Lake Charles area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain-bands, dangerous rip currents, and possible channel restrictions for vessel traffic due to rising water levels.
